==Events==
* [[238]] &ndash; The [[Praetorian Guard]] storm the palace and capture [[Pupienus and Balbinus]]. They are dragged through the streets of [[Ancient Rome|Rome]] and executed. On the same day, [[Gordian III]], age 13, is proclaimed emperor.
* [[615]] &ndash; [[K'inich Janaab' Pakal|Pakal]] ascends the throne of [[Palenque]] at the age of 12.
* [[904]] &ndash; [[Sack of Thessalonica (904)|Sack of Thessalonica]]: Saracen raiders under [[Leo of Tripoli]] sack [[Thessaloniki]], the Byzantine Empire's second-largest city, after a short siege, and plunder it for a week.
*[[1014]] &ndash; [[Byzantine–Bulgarian wars]]: [[Battle of Kleidion]] &ndash; [[List of Byzantine emperors|Byzantine emperor]] [[Basil II]] inflicts a decisive defeat on the [[Bulgaria]]n army, and his subsequent treatment of 15,000 prisoners reportedly causes [[Samuel of Bulgaria|Tsar Samuil of Bulgaria]] to die of a heart attack less than three months later, on [[October 6]].
*[[1018]] &ndash; Count [[Dirk III, Count of Holland|Dirk III]] defeats an army sent by [[Henry II, Holy Roman Emperor|Emperor Henry II]] in the [[Battle of Vlaardingen]].
*[[1030]] &ndash; [[Earls of Lade|Ladejarl]]-[[Hereditary Kingdom of Norway|Fairhair]] succession wars: [[Battle of Stiklestad]] &ndash; [[Olaf II of Norway|King Olaf II]] fights and dies trying to regain his [[List of Norwegian monarchs|Norwegian throne]] from the [[Danes]].
*[[1148]] &ndash; The [[Siege of Damascus (1148)|Siege of Damascus]] ends in a decisive crusader defeat and leads to the disintegration of the [[Second Crusade]].
*[[1565]] &ndash; The widowed [[Mary, Queen of Scots]], marries [[Henry Stuart, Lord Darnley]], [[Duke of Albany]], at [[Holyrood Palace]] in [[Edinburgh]], Scotland.
*[[1567]] &ndash; [[James VI and I|James VI]] is crowned King of [[Kingdom of Scotland|Scotland]] at [[Stirling]].
*[[1588]] &ndash; [[Anglo-Spanish War (1585–1604)|Anglo-Spanish War]]: [[Spanish Armada#Battle of Gravelines|Battle of Gravelines]] &ndash; English [[Royal Navy|naval]] forces under the command of [[Charles Howard, 1st Earl of Nottingham|Lord Charles Howard]] and Sir [[Francis Drake]] defeat the [[Spanish Armada]] off the coast of [[Gravelines]], France.
*[[1693]] &ndash; [[Nine Years' War|War of the Grand Alliance]]: [[Battle of Landen]] &ndash; France wins a [[Pyrrhic victory]] over Allied forces in the Netherlands.
*[[1793]] &ndash; [[John Graves Simcoe]] decides to build a fort and settlement at Toronto, having sailed into the bay there.
*[[1836]] &ndash; Inauguration of the [[Arc de Triomphe]] in Paris, France.
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[Great Famine (Ireland)|Irish Potato Famine]]: [[Young Irelander Rebellion of 1848|Tipperary Revolt]] &ndash; in [[Tipperary]], Ireland, then in the United Kingdom, an unsuccessful [[Irish nationalism|nationalist]] revolt against British rule is put down by police.
*[[1851]] &ndash; [[Annibale de Gasparis]] discovers [[asteroid]] [[15 Eunomia]].
*[[1858]] &ndash; United States and Japan sign the [[Treaty of Amity and Commerce (United States–Japan)|Harris Treaty]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] spy [[Belle Boyd]] is arrested by [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] troops and detained at the [[Old Capitol Prison]] in Washington, D.C.
*[[1899]] &ndash; The [[Hague Conventions of 1899 and 1907|First Hague Convention]] is signed.
*[[1900]] &ndash; In Italy, King [[Umberto I of Italy]] is assassinated by the [[Anarchism|anarchist]] [[Gaetano Bresci]].
*[[1907]] &ndash; Sir [[Robert Baden-Powell, 1st Baron Baden-Powell|Robert Baden-Powell]] sets up the [[Brownsea Island Scout camp]] in [[Poole Harbour]] on the south coast of England. The camp runs from August 1 to August 9, 1907, and is regarded as the foundation of the [[Scouting]] movement.
*[[1913]] &ndash; the Norwegian football club [[Vålerenga Fotball]] was founded.
*[[1920]] &ndash; Construction of the [[Link River Dam]] begins as part of the [[Klamath Project|Klamath Reclamation Project]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; [[Adolf Hitler]] becomes leader of the [[Nazi Party|National Socialist German Workers Party]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; [[Great Depression]]: in Washington, D.C., troops disperse the last of the "[[Bonus Army]]" of World War I veterans.
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Tungchow Mutiny|Tōngzhōu Incident]]: in [[Tongzhou District, Beijing|Tōngzhōu, China]], the [[East Hopei Army]] attacks Japanese troops and civilians.
*[[1945]] &ndash; The [[BBC Light Programme]] radio station is launched for mainstream light entertainment and music.
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[Olympic Games]]: [[1948 Summer Olympics|The Games of the XIV Olympiad]] &ndash; after a hiatus of 12 years caused by World War II, the first [[Summer Olympic Games|Summer Olympics]] to be held since the [[1936 Summer Olympics]] in Berlin, open in London.
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Korean War]]: After four days, the [[No Gun Ri Massacre]] ends when the US Army [[7th Cavalry Regiment]] is withdrawn.
*[[1957]] &ndash; The [[International Atomic Energy Agency]] is established.
*[[1958]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] signs into law the [[National Aeronautics and Space Act]], which creates the [[NASA|National Aeronautics and Space Administration]] (NASA).
*[[1959]] &ndash; First [[United States Congress]] elections in Hawaii as a state of the [[United States|Union]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: the first 4,000 [[101st Airborne Division]] paratroopers arrive in [[Vietnam]], landing at [[Cam Ranh Bay]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; Vietnam War: off the coast of [[North Vietnam]] the {{USS|Forrestal|CV-59|6}} catches on [[1967 USS Forrestal fire|fire]] in the worst U.S. naval disaster since World War II, killing 134.
*  1967   &ndash; During the fourth day of celebrating its 400th anniversary, the city of [[Caracas|Caracas, Venezuela]] is shaken by [[1967 Caracas earthquake|an earthquake]], leaving approximately 500 dead.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Greek republic referendum, 1973|Greeks vote to abolish the monarchy]], beginning the first period of the [[Metapolitefsi]].
*  1973   &ndash; During the [[1973 Dutch Grand Prix|Dutch Grand Prix]] driver [[Roger Williamson]] was killed in the race, after a suspected tyre failure caused the car to pitch into the barriers at high speed.
*[[1976]] &ndash; In New York City, [[David Berkowitz]] (aka the "Son of Sam") kills one person and seriously wounds another in the first of a series of attacks.
*[[1980]] &ndash; Iran adopts a new [[Flag of Iran|"holy" flag]] after the [[Islamic Revolution]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; A worldwide television audience of over 700 million people watch the [[wedding of Charles, Prince of Wales, and Lady Diana Spencer]] at [[St Paul's Cathedral]] in London.
*[[1987]] &ndash; British Prime Minister [[Margaret Thatcher]] and President of France [[François Mitterrand]] sign the agreement to build a tunnel under the [[English Channel]] ([[Eurotunnel]]).
*  1987   &ndash; Prime Minister of India [[Rajiv Gandhi]] and President of Sri Lanka [[J. R. Jayewardene]] sign the [[Indo-Sri Lanka Accord]] on ethnic issues.
*[[1993]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Court of Israel]] acquits alleged [[Nazism|Nazi]] death camp guard [[John Demjanjuk]] of all charges and he is set free.
*[[1996]] &ndash; The child protection portion of the [[Communications Decency Act]] is struck down by a [[United States federal courts|U.S. federal court]] as too broad.
*[[2005]] &ndash; Astronomers announce their discovery of the dwarf planet [[Eris (dwarf planet)|Eris]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; An overloaded passenger ferry [[Kasai River disaster|capsizes]] on the [[Kasai River]] in [[Bandundu Province]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], resulting in at least 80 deaths.
*[[2013]] &ndash; Two passenger trains [[Granges-près-Marnand train crash|collide]] in the Swiss municipality of [[Granges-près-Marnand]] near [[Lausanne]] injuring 25 people.
